p: Lesions in the liver and pancreas were examined for expression levels of TNF-α and TNF-related apoptosis-inducing ligand (TRAIL), which are known as ‘death ligands’. Expression patterns of the death ligands were similar to the distribution of HEV in both organs. In the liver, TNF-α expression was stronger in infiltrated lymphocytes than in hepatocytes, and TRAIL expression showed a similar pattern, but was lower than TNF-α expression (Fig. 6A,B). High levels of TNF-α and TRAIL were observed exclusively in acinar cells throughout the pancreas (Fig. 7A,B). However, although ruptured cell membranes, nuclear condensation, and high expression levels of death ligands were observed in the pancreas, terminal deoxynucleotidyl transferase dUTP nick-end labelling (TUNEL)-positive cells were not observed (Fig. 7C). In the liver, only a very weak signal, which was very low when compared to the severity of lymphocytic infiltration, was observed (Fig. 6C).
